sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"宣布，公开"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: announce, declare, proclaim, pronounce, advertise, broadcast, publish
means: announce ：多指首次宣布大家感兴趣或可满足大家好奇心的事情。
declare ：侧重正式就某事清楚明白地宣布。
proclaim ：指官方宣布重大事件或施政方针，语体比announce正式。
pronounce ：词义与announce, declare接近，但较多用于指法律判决方面的宣布。
advertise ：指通过文字和图像资料等的反复宣传而引起公众的注意，有时隐含令人不快或言过其实的意味。
broadcast ：专指利用广播或电视传播消息或发表见解。
publish ：专指通过报刊或其它媒介向公众公布事情。

sentence.Network_en: His classic boyish looks seemed to proclaim his good humour and openness.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的长相非常孩子气,显得性情很好且诚实坦率.

sentence.Network_en: The first Slav pope, John Paul, said that providence had chosen him to proclaim the spiritual unity of Europe.
sentence.Network_cn: 第一位斯拉夫教皇约翰·保罗声称上天选择了他来昭示欧洲的精神统一。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English proclame, from Latin proclamare 'cry out', from pro- 'forth' + clamare 'to shout'. The change in the second syllable was due to association with the verb claim

entry.def: If people proclaim something, they formally make it known to the public.

example.ex: The Boers rebelled against British rule, proclaiming their independence on 30 December 1880...
example.tran: 布尔人反抗英国统治，并于1880年12月30日宣布独立。

example.ex: Britain proudly proclaims that it is a nation of animal lovers...
example.tran: 英国骄傲地声称自己是一个热爱动物的国家。

entry.def: If you proclaim something, you state it in an emphatic way.

example.ex: 'I think we have been heard today,' he proclaimed...
example.tran: “我想今天我们说的大家都听见了，”他明确地说。

example.ex: He confidently proclaims that he is offering the best value in the market.
example.tran: 他信心百倍地声称他的产品是市场上最物有所值的。

means.word_mean: 1. declare formally; declare someone to be something; of titles;

sentences.sentence: "`I am not a Communist,' " he exclaimed

means.word_mean: 3. affirm or declare as an attribute or quality of;

sentences.sentence: "The speech predicated the fitness of the candidate to be President"

auth_sentence.content: He would proclaim mistaken identity wouldn't he?
auth_sentence.res_content: He would proclaim mistaken identity wouldn't he?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He would proclaim mistaken identity wouldn't he?

auth_sentence.content: "I'm a novelist," Capp liked to proclaim.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: "I'm a novelist," Capp liked to proclaim.

auth_sentence.content: He had state journalists proclaim him the man who impresses me!
auth_sentence.res_content: He had state journalists proclaim him the man who impresses me!
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He had state journalists proclaim him the man who impresses me!

stems_affixes.word_buile: declaim[[v.朗诵;谴责]]→n.慷慨演说;雄辩
proclaim[[v.公布;声明]]省鷑.宣告;宣言
ac一再+claim呼喊,叫喊→一再喊→欢呼
pro在前+claim呼喊,叫喊→在前面喊→公布
re回+claim呼喊,叫喊→喊回来→收回来,引申为开荒

sentences.en: The government has proclaimed a new law.
sentences.cn: 政府已公布了一项新法令。

sentences.en: The ringing bells proclaimed the birth of the prince.
sentences.cn: 响亮的钟声宣布王子的诞生。

sentences.en: The constitution proclaims that public property shall be inviolate.
sentences.cn: 宪法宣告公共财产不可侵犯。

sentences.en: The government proclaimed both of them national heroes.
sentences.cn: 政府宣布他们两人为民族英雄。

means.word_mean: 显示；明确显示；成为标志；表明

sentences.en: His accent proclaimed that he was a southerner.
sentences.cn: 他的口音表明他是南方人。

sentences.en: His manners proclaimed him a gentleman.
sentences.cn: 他的风度显示出他是绅士。

jushi.english: Their new policy was proclaimed last week.
jushi.chinese: 上周已宣布了他们的新政策。

jushi.english: They loudly proclaimed the quality of his wife.
jushi.chinese: 他们大声称赞他妻子的美德。

jushi.english: The leaves of trees gradually turned yellow; it proclaimed the arrival of autumn.
jushi.chinese: 树叶变黄,表明秋天的来临。
